title: Cancer Hallmark Classification Using Bidirectional Encoder Representations From Transformers. (arXiv:2305.03501v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: This paper presents a novel approach to accurately classify the hallmarks of cancer, which is a crucial task in cancer research. Our proposed method utilizes the Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers (BERT) architecture, which has shown exceptional performance in various downstream applications. By applying transfer learning, we fine-tuned the pre-trained BERT model on a small corpus of biomedical text documents related to cancer. The outcomes of our experimental investigations demonstrate that our approach attains a noteworthy accuracy of 94.45%, surpassing almost all prior findings with a substantial increase of at least 8.04% as reported in the literature. These findings highlight the effectiveness of our proposed model in accurately classifying and comprehending text documents for cancer research, thus contributing significantly to the field. As cancer remains one of the top ten leading causes of death globally, our approach holds great promise in advancing cancer

translated_title: 利用Transformers双向编码器表征的癌症标志分类方法
translated_abstract: 本文提出了一种新的方法来精确地分类癌症的标志，这是癌症研究中至关重要的任务。我们提出的方法利用了双向编码器表征的Transformers（BERT）架构，在小型癌症生物医学文本语料库上进行预训练模型的微调。实验结果表明，我们的方法取得了94.45%的显著精度，这比文献中几乎所有之前的研究结果都要高出至少8.04%。这些发现突显了我们提出的模型在准确分类和理解癌症研究文本文献方面的有效性，因此对该领域做出了显著贡献。由于癌症仍然是全球十大死因之一，我们的方法在推进癌症研究方面具有巨大的潜力。
tldr: 本文通过在小型癌症生物医学文本语料库上微调BERT模型，提出了一种高精度分类癌症标志的方法，并在实验中取得了94.45%的精度，比以往文献的研究结果高出至少8.04%。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a high-accuracy method for classifying cancer hallmarks by fine-tuning a pre-trained BERT model on a small corpus of biomedical text documents related to cancer. The approach achieves a significant accuracy of 94.45%, surpassing prior literature findings by at least 8.04%, highlighting the potential of the approach in advancing cancer research.
